channel.title: Debugging on harre.dev
channel.description: Recent content in Debugging on harre.dev

item.title: Easy Windows Service debugging
item.description: Long-running processes in a web application running on IIS is a bad idea. The reason for that is that IIS might unload the AppPool that is running your process due to inactivity. Inactivity? Yep, if IIS does not recieve a requests for a while, it will shut the site down to conserve system resources. (This is all configurable ofcourse, but I’ve seen it happen) To allow for long-running stuff, a Windows Service might be a right fit.
